Topics.Definition: Introduction to sets, elements, representation.
Sets and their representations, roster form, set-builder notation.
Empty set, finite sets, subsets, cardinality.
Subsets of a set, power set, universal set, complement of a set.
Operations on sets, union, intersection, difference, complement.
Venn diagrams, representing operations on sets.
Applications of sets in various fields.

Equations.Explanation: Number of elements in the complement of set A.
Number of elements in the union of sets A and B.
Number of elements in the intersection of sets A and B.
Number of elements in the difference of sets A and B.

Topics.Definition: Introduction to relations, functions, domain, co-domain, range.
Types of relations, reflexive, symmetric, transitive relations.
Equivalence relations, equivalence classes, partition of a set.
Functions, domain, co-domain, range, types of functions.
Algebra of real functions, sum, difference, product, quotient.
Types of functions, one-one, onto, invertible functions.
Composition of functions, composite functions.

Equations.Explanation: Composition of functions f and g.
Function f maps elements from set A to set B.
Endomorphism, function maps set A to itself.

Topics.Definition: Introduction to trigonometric functions, ratios in a right triangle.

Topics.Topic: Trigonometric Ratios of Some Specific Angles
Topics.Definition: Trigonometric ratios of 0°, 30°, 45°, 60°, 90°.
Trigonometric ratios of complementary angles, sine, cosine, tangent.
Trigonometric identities, sum and difference formulae, double angle formulae.
Height and distances, angle of elevation, angle of depression.
Trigonometric equations, solving trigonometric equations.
Inverse trigonometric functions, principal value branches.

Chapter: Principle of Mathematical Induction (Class 11 NCERT Mathematics)

Topics.Definition: Introduction to mathematical induction, principle, motivation.
The principle of mathematical induction, basis step, inductive step.
Strong induction, well-ordering principle, induction hypotheses.
Applications of mathematical induction in proofs and problems.

Equations.Explanation: Statement to be proved using mathematical induction.

Topics.Definition: Introduction to linear inequalities, solutions, graphical representation.
Inequalities and their solutions, solution sets, algebraic solutions.
Graphical representation of inequalities, number line, half-plane.

Topics.Topic: Graphical Solution of Linear Inequalities in Two Variables
Topics.Definition: Graphical solution of linear inequalities, shading regions, feasible region.
Algebraic solutions of linear inequalities, solving inequalities.
Inequalities with absolute values, solving absolute value inequalities.
Applications of linear inequalities in real-life situations.
Introduction to permutations, combinations, factorial notation.
Fundamental principle of counting, multiplication rule, addition rule.
Permutations of objects, arrangements, permutations of 'n' distinct objects.
Combinations of objects, selections, combinations of 'n' distinct objects.

Topics.Topic: Permutations and Combinations of n Things Taken r at a Time
Topics.Definition: Permutations and combinations of 'n' things taken 'r' at a time.
Combinations with repetitions, identical objects, generating functions.
Pascal's triangle, binomial theorem, coefficients, properties.
Applications of permutations and combinations in real-life scenarios.
Introduction to binomial theorem, binomial expansion, coefficients.

Topics.Topic: Statement and Proof of Binomial Theorem
Topics.Definition: Statement and proof of binomial theorem for positive integral indices.

Topics.Topic: General and Middle Term in Binomial Expansion
Topics.Definition: General and middle term in binomial expansion, finding terms.
Applications of binomial theorem, mathematical calculations.
Introduction to sequence, terms, types of sequences.
Arithmetic progression, common difference, nth term of AP.

Topics.Topic: Sum of n Terms of an AP
Topics.Definition: Sum of n terms of an AP, arithmetic series.
Geometric progression, common ratio, nth term of GP.

Topics.Topic: Sum of n Terms of a GP
Topics.Definition: Sum of n terms of a GP, geometric series.
Infinite geometric series, sum to infinity, convergence.
Special series, sum of squares, sum of cubes, etc.

Equations.Explanation: Sum of n terms of arithmetic progression (AP).
Sum of n terms of geometric progression (GP).

Topics.Definition: Introduction to straight lines, coordinate geometry basics.
Slope of a line, angle of inclination, slope-intercept form.

Topics.Topic: Various Forms of Equation of a Line
Topics.Definition: Various forms of equation of a line, point-slope form, two-point form.
General equation of a line, standard form, intercept form.
Distance formula, distance between two points.
Section formula, dividing a line segment in a given ratio.
Area of a triangle formed by three given points.

Equations.Explanation: Slope formula for a line passing through points (x_1, y_1) and (x_2, y_2).
Point-slope form equation of a line.
Two-point form equation of a line.

Topics.Definition: Introduction to conic sections, various conics.
Sections of a cone, circle, ellipse, parabola, hyperbola.
Circle, equation of circle in various forms, standard equations.
Ellipse, standard equations, major and minor axes, foci.
Parabola, standard equations, focus, directrix, vertex.
Hyperbola, standard equations, foci, asymptotes.

Equations.Explanation: Standard equation of a circle with center (h, k) and radius r.
Standard equation of an ellipse with major axis a and minor axis b.
Standard equation of a parabola with vertex at origin and axis along y-axis.

Chapter: Introduction to Three–dimensional Geometry (Class 11 NCERT Mathematics)

Topics.Definition: Introduction to three-dimensional space, coordinate axes.

Topics.Topic: Coordinate Axes and Coordinate Planes in Three Dimensions
Topics.Definition: Coordinate axes and planes in three dimensions, octants.

Topics.Topic: Distance between Two Points and Section Formula
Topics.Definition: Distance between two points, section formula in 3D.
Direction cosines and direction ratios, angles between lines.

Topics.Topic: Equation of a Line in Space
Topics.Definition: Equation of a line in three-dimensional space.
Equation of a plane, normal vector, distance from origin.

Equations.Explanation: Distance formula between two points (x_1, y_1, z_1) and (x_2, y_2, z_2).

Equations.Equation: l = cos(α), m = cos(β), n = cos(γ)
l / a = m / b = n / c

Equations.Explanation: Equation of a line passing through point (x_1, y_1, z_1) with direction ratios l, m, n.
Equation of a plane with normal vector (l, m, n).

Topics.Definition: Introduction to limits, approach to a particular value.
Limits of a function, limit at a point, left and right limits.
Limits of trigonometric functions, standard limits.
Continuity of a function at a point, continuity in an interval.
Derivatives, rate of change, derivative as a function.
Derivatives of trigonometric functions, standard derivatives.
Derivatives of composite functions, chain rule.
Derivatives of implicit functions, implicit differentiation.

Equations.Explanation: Limit of a function f(x) as x approaches a.

Equations.Equation: f(x) is continuous at x = a
Equations.Explanation: Definition of continuity at a point.
Definition of continuity in an interval [a, b].
Definition of derivative of a function f(x).

Topics.Definition: Introduction to mathematical reasoning, statements, logical connectives.
Implications, quantifiers, universal quantifier, existential quantifier.
Validating statements using mathematical reasoning.
Theorems, axioms, mathematical proof, direct and indirect proofs.
Mathematical reasoning in writing proofs, clarity, logical flow.
Introduction to statistics, data collection, representation.
Statistical data, raw data, grouped data, frequency distribution.
Frequency distribution, frequency, class interval, class limit.
Cumulative frequency distribution, cumulative frequency, cumulative frequency graph.
Measures of central tendency, mean, median, mode.
Measures of dispersion, range, variance, standard deviation.
Correlation, positive and negative correlation, scatter plot.
Introduction to probability, random experiments, outcomes, events.

Equations.Explanation: Mean (average) formula for a set of data.
Mode calculation for a set of data.
Variance formula for a set of data.
Standard deviation formula for a set of data.

Topics.Definition: Introduction to probability, outcomes, events, sample space.
Probability of an event, classical probability, relative frequency.
Axiomatic approach to probability, axioms of probability.
Probability distribution, random variable, probability distribution function.
Expectation of a random variable, mean of probability distribution.
Bernoulli trials, binomial distribution, probability mass function.

Equations.Equation: P(A) = (Number of favorable outcomes) / (Total number of possible outcomes)
P(A) = (Number of times event A occurs) / (Total number of trials)

Equations.Explanation: Probability of the sample space is 1.
Expectation (mean) of a random variable X.

Equations.Equation: P(X = x) = C(n, x) * p^x * q^(n - x)
Equations.Explanation: Probability mass function for binomial distribution.
